Introduction and how I setup my Github page

Created at 01/05/2019 Updated at 01/05/2019 Category Blog Development Tag Introduction

This is my first post!! Finally got to put this site together... #Babysteps
For anyone starting out with absolutely no knowledge for web development (like me XD),
here are the documents you can read up to:
Set up Git, *note that I've downloaded SmartGit over Git.
Or get GitHub Desktop if you prefer visual file management over command line.
I recommend using the command line (Git/SmartGit) for it's utility although it might be harder to master at first.

Installation of Jekyll (for Github Page development).

After installing Git/Github and Jekyll, *set up your GitHub Pages site locally with Jekyll.
This allows user to code and test the site on the laptop/desktop (locally), before publishing online (push to github repository).
*On Step 3, an additional step "$ git pull" command was used between part 9 and 10, part 10 "$ git push -u origin master" command was changed to ""$ git push -f origin master" command for first time (forced) push to Github account repository.

Feel free to check out and download my code at github.com/limweilun/limweilun.github.io.
PM me at weilun0099@gmail.com for anything related to this post, I'm still learning too!
